description: Comprehensive 3-Tier Class System for Diablo-Style Game
notes: Base classes promote to advanced classes at level 10 and 20. Each class has 3 skill branches with 3 skills each (9 total). Each skill has 3 levels.

legendaryClasses.description: Tier 2 classes at level 20. Each advanced class branches into 2 legendary classes.
legendaryClasses.note: Omitted for brevity - follow same pattern as tier 1 with 2 parents per tier 2 class

tier_0_to_1.description: Tier 1 advancement is automatic upon reaching level 10. Choose one specialization.

tier_1_to_2.description: Tier 2 advancement is automatic upon reaching level 20. Choose one legendary specialization.

skillSystem.skillBarMechanics: Player can select any 6 unlocked skills from their class to place in active skill bar. Skills can be reordered and swapped anytime outside combat.

tier1Advanced.knight: Row 1, Col 0 (knight - same as warrior, but displayed differently in UI)

tier2Legendary.description: Available from rows 0-5 of rogues.png 32x32 grid

implementation: Store all data in CLASS_DATA constant in HTML
Player classKey becomes 'warrior_base' initially, then 'knight' or 'berserker' at level 10
Only unlocked skills (level > 0) can be placed in skill bar
Skills inherit stats scaling from baseStats + equipment affixes
3-level system means skill points are precious - careful progression builds
Keep skill descriptions concise but flavor-rich (Japanese names in UI)
designPhilosophy: Each class has distinct playstyle: Knight defends, Berserker attacks, Assassin strikes precisely
Tier 1 classes feel like meaningful progressions - not just stat bumps
Skills 1-3 in each branch form a power progression (simple â†’ complex â†’ ultimate)
Every class has 9 skills total to manage (6 slots = active choice system)
Skills should synergize within branches but work independently
Late-game should reward player knowledge of which 6 skills to use per situation
balanceNotes: Warrior branch (Knight/Berserker) focuses on survivability vs offense trade
Rogue branch (Assassin/Ranger) focuses on single target vs AoE trade
Sorcerer branch (Pyromancer/Frostbolt/Arcanist) focuses on damage type specialization
MP costs scale with level: Lv1 cheap, Lv3 expensive
Cooldowns stay consistent across levels - balance via damage not speed
Each branch has 1-2 utility skills + 1-2 damage skills + 1 ultimate
